metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34568 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
SDL v1.2 was discovered to contain a use-after-free via the XFree function at /src/video/x11/SDL_x11yuv.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1+esm2').
libsdl2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
